div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-OiUrBf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: April 8, 2020
Dear Pohatcong Families:

Thank you for your cooperation and dedication during this unprecedented time of online instruction. We appreciate your patience and tireless efforts in educating our children. Please know you can reach out to our teachers or us for any assistance that you need. The Child Study Team is dedicated to serving our families and also have a Google Classroom page with information on counseling and community resources.

To the families who have been affected by the virus, we wish you comfort and healing. To those who are working in health care on the front lines of this battle, we thank you for your service. To those of you who are working in a service industry during this unprecedented time, we also thank you.
We hope that you enjoy Spring Break from Thursday, April 9, to Tuesday, April 14, with your family and you find strength in your compassion and commitment to each other.
There will be no new assignments during this time. We wish you good health and happiness during this break and throughout the year.
Sincerely
Diane Mandry Keith Kullman
Superintendent Principal

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: March 30, 2020
Dear Pohatcong Parents/Guardians and Students:

First, I want to thank you for your resilience and cooperation during this unprecedented time. I am continually impressed by everyone’s positive attitude to make the best of this unusual situation. Although our school halls are empty, I realize that parents, teachers, and students are all hard at work.

As I wrote in a previous correspondence, our school remains closed and there is no return date established. We will follow the directives of the Governor’s Office and the New Jersey Department of Education.

Our staff has been working hard to deliver remote instruction, and I am in awe daily of their commitment to our children. They are available through Google Classroom, their school phone extension, or email for any questions. Please do not hesitate to contact them.
If your child is not feeling well and cannot complete classwork for the day, please call our attendance line. We are required to take attendance by the New Jersey Department of Education.
We have been notified that the spring administration of all New Jersey statewide standardized assessments has been cancelled.
Chromebooks are still available for pick up by appointment. Please contact Mike Slattery, Director of Special Services, at mslattery@pohatcong.org. He will promptly respond to you.

During these trying times, we understand that some families may incur financial hardship, please know that you can apply for free and reduced lunch and breakfast benefits at any time. Applications are available online and in the book house by the playground. Meals for the week are distributed in the cafeteria in bags to be taken home. If you are unable to pick up meals, we can make delivery arrangements.

Keith Kullman, Mike Slattery, and I are also available through our school phone extensions or emails for any questions or concerns. In addition, please check our website at www. Pohatcong.org for regular updates.
Sincerely,
Diane Mandry

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Good morning, this is Mr. Kullman from Pohatcong School.

The purpose of this email is to inform our parents about Google classroom. Google Classroom is an App provided by Google that is a useful tool for teachers to use to engage students in meaningful instruction. All of our students at Pohatcong School have a username and password that is used to access Google Apps and features under our Pohatcong domain.

Starting next week, all teachers will be utilizing a Google Classroom as their main method of communicating and interacting with students and their workflow. Google Classroom allows teachers to create classes, post assignments, organize folders, and view work in real-time.

I have created and designed my very own Google Classroom titled Principal Kullman’s Class for Parents. Prior to the release of the teacher pages on Google Classroom, I will be inviting all of our Pohatcong students to this class using their pohatcong.org usernames. I would encourage all parents, especially those that have never seen a Google Classroom, to login with your student and navigate to Google Classroom together.
All invitations to the Google Classrooms, including Principal Kullman’s Classroom and each of the teachers Google Classrooms, will be sent to the students pohatcong.org account.

I would like to ask that all parents watch the attached video. The tutorial video will assist you and your child in becoming familiar with Google Classroom and logging in to the account. All students will need to be signed into Google Chrome using their pohatcong.org username to access the Classroom App.
After viewing the instructional video, please attempt to sign in to your device with your child and access Google Chrome and Google Classroom together.
For Kindergarten students, an additional email will be sent via Connect-Ed with additional information just for you.
If you need any assistance, please do not hesitate to contact me at kkullman@pohatcong.org or (908) 859-8155 x 2103
Thank you,
Mr. Kullman

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Good Afternoon Pohatcong School Community, this is Keith Kullman Principal of Pohatcong School.

By an executive order from Governor Murphy, he has directed, "All schools in New Jersey, both public and private, to close and remain closed as long as the Order remains in effect." We are closely monitoring the situation and reassessing the duration of this closure.

We appreciate your cooperation during the first week of virtual instruction. Although this is uncharted territory for all of us, our community has proven resilient as we continue to protect the health and safety of our students and staff. We thank you for your patience and understanding as we work through this difficult situation.

Please continue to contact me, Keith Kullman, Principal, at extension 2103 or kkullman@pohatcong.org, Michael Slattery, Director of Special Services, at extension 2111 or mslattery@pohatcong.org or your child's teacher for any needs. Information can also be found on our webpage at pohatcong.org. We are happy to assist you in any way possible.
Have a great evening and stay safe.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Good Evening Pohatcong Families. This is Keith Kullman from Pohatcong School.

I hope that this message finds you and you family doing well. We have ALL been working very hard, together as a School and a Community to navigate through this difficult challenge. We will persevere through this, however we will be faced with many challenges in the days ahead.
It is NOT too late for a Chromebook. Chromebooks are available to students. Please call for an appointment (908) 859-8155. If you leave a message, we will return your call in a timely manner.

If you receive free and reduced breakfast and lunch, daily pick up is between 9:00 and 12:00 in the cafeteria. Please have one person enter the building. Contact the school if you do not have transportation. If you want to apply for free and reduced lunch, applications are available on the website and in the book house by the playground. This application can be completed at anytime. Contact Sue Gurneak if you need assistance with application or would like to return the application. sgurneak@pohatcong.org or (908) 859-8155 x2109

Your child’s teachers, Mike Slattery, Director of Specials Services, and Diane Mandry, Superintendent, and I are available daily by email or their phone extension. Voice mails are automatically sent to email for staff to retrieve.
Please view the video of this announcement. https://www.wevideo.com/view/1618142342
Please contact your child's teacher or the office if you have any questions, concerns, or needs.
Thank you and Stay Safe

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Good Afternoon Pohatcong School Community, this is Keith Kullman from Pohatcong School.

This message serves to provide our school community with a few updates and important information. Administration continues to be in contact with the Warren County Office of Education and the Department of Health on a regular basis. Any relevant information for our community will be posted on our website and sent via our automated communication system.

All school staff are available during regular school hours by email and by phone. The number to contact the school is (908) 859-8155. Voicemails and emails will be returned in a timely manner. If you have questions that can not be answered by the classroom teacher during this difficult time, please contact:

ul.li: Keith Kullman, Principal X2103 or kkullman@pohatcong.org
Mike Slattery, Director of Special Services X2111 or mslattery@pohatcong.org
Diane Mandry, Superintendent X2104 or dmandry@pohatcong.org

div.p: All students have received a packet of materials, including plans to complete the 10 days of homeschooling assignments. A link to the homeschooling plans and materials will be available on our website later today. The assignments posted on the school website are the same assignments as you have received in the blue folder on Friday. There are no new assignments at this time.

During this time of Home Instruction, Pohatcong School is still required to collect attendance from families. If your child is sick and unable to participate in Home Instruction, please notify the school by telephone (908) 859-8155 and press 3 to report your absence to the absentee line.
In addition, on the school web page, you can find community resources available to keep everyone safe and healthy.
We hope that you and your family are safe during this difficult time. Please feel free to contact us with any needs or concerns that you may have.
Thank you, stay safe, and let us know if there is anything we can help you with.
Have a great evening.
